Ken,

Moose is a new object framework for Perl that simplifies and
standardizes a lot of things.

The archives show John Arrowwood <jarrowwx@...> said "I'm almost done
with the Perl code of my NEAT version" on Mon Jun 7, 2004 7:00 pm.  I
wonder if that code is floating around somewhere?

Thanks,
Ben

On Fri, Dec 12, 2008 at 10:07 PM, Kenneth Stanley
<kstanley@...> wrote:
> Ben, I do not know of any Perl-based NEAT implementations, so yours
> would likely be the first. So it would probably be appreciated by
> those who prefer Perl.
>
> Unfortunately, I don't know anything about Moose!
>
> ken
>
> --- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Ben" <synaptic.axon@...> wrote:
>>
>> Hello,
>>
>> Is there a publicly available Perl version of NEAT (or any of the
>> variants)? If there's some existing code out there, I would probably
>> just use that but I'd really love to see a Perl NEAT module on CPAN
>> and would be interested in contributing somehow to help that happen.
>>
>> I have an attempt at a Moose-based version but am only about 60-70%
>> there working from the windows c++ version. Moose might have too much
>> overhead but I thought it would be convenient and both easier to
>> maintain and extend. I'm still something of a Moose noob but it seems
>> like a good fit.
>>
>> Thanks for any information.
>>
>> Ben
>>
>
>
